title:
An efficient particle tracking method on unstructured meshes in two and
  three dimensions based on patch searching
abstract:
We present a particle tracking method for unstructured meshes in two and
three dimensions. Our tracking algorithm is based on a patch searching and
includes two steps. We first locate the given point to a patch near a vertex,
and then the host element is determined within the patch domain. We prove that
the patch in the first step can be rapidly identified by constructing an
auxiliary Cartesian grid with a prescribed resolution. Then, the second step
can be converted into a searching problem, which can be easily solved by
searching algorithms. Only coordinates to particles are required in our method.
We conduct a series of numerical tests in two and three dimensions to
illustrate the robustness and efficiency in our method.
